# The `raw_ostream` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class implements an extremely fast bulk output stream that can <em>only</em> output to a stream. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::raw_ostream</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class implements an extremely fast bulk output stream that can <em>only</em> output to a stream.

It does not support seeking, reopening, rewinding, line buffered disciplines etc. It is a simple buffer that outputs a chunk at a time.

Definition at line 52 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.

### reserveExtraSpace() {#ad65ed6b6a8c96b6c1dc98ba50bc1547a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::raw&#95;ostream::reserveExtraSpace (uint64&#95;t ExtraSize)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
If possible, pre-allocate <code>ExtraSize</code> bytes for stream data.

i.e. it extends internal buffers to keep additional ExtraSize bytes. So that the stream could keep at least <a href="#a0f90ad570f71349466844ee9f2d06cd1">tell()</a> + ExtraSize bytes without re-allocations. <a href="#ad65ed6b6a8c96b6c1dc98ba50bc1547a">reserveExtraSpace()</a> does not change the size/data of the stream.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00160">160</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.

### write&#95;impl() {#aff81bd777453e69313941c475ec2a848}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::raw&#95;ostream::write&#95;impl (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Ptr, size&#95;t Size)</>}>
The is the piece of the class that is implemented by subclasses.

This writes the <code>Size</code> bytes starting at <code>Ptr</code> to the underlying stream.

This function is guaranteed to only be called at a point at which it is safe for the subclass to install a new buffer via SetBuffer.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Ptr">The start of the data to be written. For buffered streams this is guaranteed to be the start of the buffer.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">The number of bytes to be written.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Invariant">
&#123; Size &gt; 0 &#125;
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00377">377</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.

### OutBufStart {#a0045edfef76e8e677ae2ca6edf1d3104}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>char&#42; llvm::raw&#95;ostream::OutBufStart</>}>
The buffer is handled in such a way that the buffer is uninitialized, unbuffered, or out of space when OutBufCur &gt;= OutBufEnd.

Thus a single comparison suffices to determine if we need to take the slow path to write a single character.

The buffer is in one of three states:
<ul>
<li>Unbuffered (BufferMode == Unbuffered)</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Uninitialized (BufferMode != Unbuffered &amp;&amp; OutBufStart == 0).</li>
<li>Buffered (BufferMode != Unbuffered &amp;&amp; OutBufStart != 0 &amp;&amp; OutBufEnd - OutBufStart &gt;= 1).</li>
</ul>


If buffered, then the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> owns the buffer if (BufferMode == InternalBuffer); otherwise the buffer has been set via SetBuffer and is managed by the subclass.

If a subclass installs an external buffer using SetBuffer then it can wait for a 
<SectionUser title="See Also">
write&#95;impl() call to handle the <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/staticdatasplitter-cpp/#ad2fefd8832b4b1ea3dbb1f621063bbff">data</a> which has been put into this buffer.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00082">82</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
